Announcing the 11th Annual Farhang Foundation Short Film Festival, Celebrating Iranian Heritage

LOS ANGELES, APRIL 22, 2019 – Calling on filmmakers worldwide to submit short films visualizing some aspect of Iranian art, culture, and heritage. Farhang Foundation's Annual online Short Film Festival offers filmmakers the opportunity to compete for prestigious recognition and cash prizes of $10,000 (first prize), $5,000 (second prize), and $3,000 (third prize).

Since its launch in 2008, the Farhang Foundation Short Film Festival has presented over $180,000 in cash prizes to filmmakers from around the world with a mutual passion for Iran and its culture. "Over the past ten years we have witness the tremendous amount of talent that has emerged from this festival. Many of the winning filmmakers have moved on to produce and direct feature films and other impactful projects, and we are delighted to provide a platform and launching pad for up-and-coming filmmakers from around the world" said Mark Amin, Farhang Foundation Short Film Festival Jury Chair and Vice Chairman of the Board of Trustees. "We have now created an established and notable competition that is easily accessible to filmmakers from around the world, especially for those inside Iran, who can easily compete and showcase their films to an international audience and a jury of experts in the field, and this is an invaluable opportunity for any aspiring filmmaker"

The Festival's submission period opens on April 22, 2019 and ends on July 22, 2019. The award ceremony, during which the top six finalist will be screened and top three awards will be presented before a live audience, will take place on Saturday September 28, 2019 hosted by actress and comedian Melissa Shoshahi at UCLA's prestigious Schoenberg Hall, home of Farhang Foundation's newly established Iranian Music Program. The evening will also include red-carpet arrivals, extensive media coverage, celebrity guests, the participating contestants, and a reception following.

Farhang Foundation is also pleased to announce its esteemed jury panel for this year's festival. The impressive group is comprised of a diverse and talented team of international artists, each with a unique background in Cinema.

The 2019 jury panel includes the legendary father of Iranian animation, Dr. Noureddin Zarrinkelk, Golden Globe winning composer Richard Horowitz, screenwriter and playwright Dr. Naghmeh Samini, award winning actor and writer Saber Abar, and jury chair Mark Amin, CEO of Sobini Films.

"For our eleventh year anniversary, we are once again honored and privileged to welcome a stellar group of fantastic artists who have accepted our invitation to join this year's jury panel" said Alireza Ardekani, Executive Director of Farhang Foundation. "This year we have managed to gather five notable individuals with diverse backgrounds in directing, music composition, acting, writing and animation, and we look forward to their insight, knowledge and experience in selecting this year's top films in competition."

Short film submissions should be under 15 minutes in length, and can be of any genre or style, visualizing an aspect of Iranian art, history, culture, crafts, geography, cuisine, or lifestyle that will inspire and spark the audience's interest in learning more about Iranian culture. All submissions not in English must include English subtitles. In keeping with the spirit of Farhang Foundation - a nonreligious and nonpolitical organization - it is advised that submissions should refrain from endorsing or opposing any religious or political position. Full details of the submission rules can be viewed by visiting our Terms and Conditions page.

All entries will be judged for creativity, quality, and originality by the esteemed jury panel. Views expressed by the filmmakers do not represent those of Farhang Foundation or the jury panel. For more information, including submission guidelines, deadlines, and past winners, visit the official Festival website at FarhangFilmFest.org.
